medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began at 11am on the morning of admission, starting in the left lower quadrant (LLQ) and increased in intensity, spreading to suprapubic pain and radiating to the left lower back. The patient experienced nausea and vomiting multiple times, along with chills and sweats, but no objective fevers. He reported some loose bowel movements, although he had loose stools at baseline.
